Sentencas: A combined power system with solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) and gas turbine (GT) is modelled and analysed thermodynamically in this paper.
Titulo: The Development and Application of a Novel Optimisation Strategy for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine Hybrid Cycles

Sentencas: A novel optimisation strategy including the design of optimal parameters is proposed and applied to the hybrid system.
Titulo: The Development and Application of a Novel Optimisation Strategy for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine Hybrid Cycles

Sentencas: Different sources of irreversible losses are specified, and entropy analyses are used to indicate the multi-irreversibilities existing, and to assess the work potentials of the system.
Titulo: The Development and Application of a Novel Optimisation Strategy for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine Hybrid Cycles

Sentencas: Expressions of the power output and efficiency for both the subsystems and the SOFC-GT hybrid system are derived.
Titulo: The Development and Application of a Novel Optimisation Strategy for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine Hybrid Cycles

Sentencas: The optimal performance characteristics are presented and discussed in detail through a parametric analysis.
Titulo: The Development and Application of a Novel Optimisation Strategy for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine Hybrid Cycles

Sentencas: The developed model is expected to provide not only a convenient tool to determine the optimal system performance and component irreversibility, but also an appropriate basis to design similar complex hybrid power plants.
Titulo: The Development and Application of a Novel Optimisation Strategy for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine Hybrid Cycles

Sentencas: This new approach can be further extended to other energy conversion settings and electrochemical systems.
Titulo: The Development and Application of a Novel Optimisation Strategy for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine Hybrid Cycles

Sentencas: Decision makers should therefore find the methodology contained in this paper useful in the comparison and selection of advanced heat recovery systems.
Titulo: The Development and Application of a Novel Optimisation Strategy for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine Hybrid Cycles
